website_summaries.verdict: Excellent power output for its size, protecting several electronics at once during outages, with an intuitive interface for pinpoint control.
pros: Smaller and lighter mini-tower UPS that matches larger towers in power output
Included software helps monitor battery and can be configured to shut down a PC during a power outage
Automatic voltage regulation protects from minor power blips
cons: User must connect the battery on a new unit, so it’s not ready to go out of the box

customer_reviews.title: I thought my house was on fire =:-O
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for two or three months, then it started beeping and filled the room with an acrid, burning electric stank. Chucked it right in the trash. I'll take my chances without it, better that than having my house burn down.
customer_reviews.author: NotSteve

customer_reviews.title: The product failed 45 days after purchase...
customer_reviews.text: The product started smoking and failed 45 days after purchase. The warranty provider failed to respond to repeated communications requesting an RMA for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peck

customer_reviews.title: Annoying alarm.
customer_reviews.text: Editing my review. Have owned less than 6 months, twice it has shut itself down, I've come home to alarm sounding and all systems shut down. Amazon's help desk for this item is closed. Original review: Good and long life battery. Went through a power failure and it kept everything up until I could power it down, however the alarm was barely audible from downstairs. It was annoying rather than alarming.
customer_reviews.author: MONichols

customer_reviews.title: RUN AWAY, the dreaded chirp
customer_reviews.text: I"m a long time user with APC, so when my old APC finally died I went with another APC. BIG BIG MISTAKE. Should have listened to the bad reviews. Every thing was fine for a couple of weeks then the dreaded chirping started. Chirp, chirp, chirp, chirp, chirp, chirp, ever few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Broke almost instantly, terrible costumer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May this year, it operated two small appliances, a home modem and home router. less than 40 days after opening, it alarmed, then popped and smoked. I have been working with costumer service for MONTHS to try and get a replacement as per their warranty. Impossible to get a response from, impossible to make progress on the warranty replacement. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Had nothing but problems with it. Tried to contact company did not get a reply, their mail does not work. I will not purchase any other product of there’s.
customer_reviews.author: David McCalla

customer_reviews.title: Check out this device immediately upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Bought directly from mfg. Dead on arrival. Replacement in process. New equipment without protection for several week (projected). We will see how this plays out. Operating over $5k computer and monitor in unsafe condition. Not happy. If you get one of these devices check it out on the day of it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Medical Physicist

customer_reviews.title: Bought hoping for sine wave approximation - no joy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit hoping for a "many-step" close approximation to a pure sine wave. As you can see from the scope photo the output isn't even close. The unit was being asked to deliver 60 Watts, which should hardly have been a struggle for it. I have to say I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: EastTNBill

customer_reviews.title: If the battery is dead, its up to the buyer to figure out what to do nex
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these battery backups (with the understanding that APC has one of the best reputations). Two of them worked, but one did not. The battery was dead. Amazon instructed me to contact the seller. The seller wants to "troubleshoot" with me, instructing me to REMOVE the battery from one unit and place it in another unit. I am not an "IT person", and am not qualified to take their equipment APART, in order to prove to them that it doesn't work. The next time I need to order a battery backup, I'll be going to the local office supply store, and will not be ordering it online, through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: BX1500M
customer_reviews.text: Product was DOA. Battery was half charged. Let charge for 24 hours and battery would not charge. Tried to get tech support but apparantly this is outsourced and not supported by Amazon. I got a replacement bx1500m and the replacement is working. I raised my star from 1 to 3. Im pleased that i got a quick replacement but support was poor. I talked to 2 different people and both had no clue and seemed to have been reading from a script
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Failed just over a year
customer_reviews.text: After a little over a year the unit started acting up and beeping saying it had no battery. Using some resets, and pulling the battery out and putting it back in got it working again. A few months later and nothing can be done to make it work. It just shows the no battery symbol and chirps constantly. I used to buy APC products because they’ve been solid for the last 20 years, but will be replacing them slowly as this is the third (of 6) new APC units I have had died on me within 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: "F02" - Improper usage
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product until the power goes out. The first outage (1 month after install) with a light load and the unit goes into "F02". It does not supply power, one of two units started to smoke. At least it didn't smoke my equipment. APC blamed it on "improper usage", one 250W max output PC, uh huh. Do not plug your toaster into it either. But they were so generous to still allow a warranty replacement. Unit out of stock, 2 weeks until it ships. I cannot wait for another "F02" brick! I'd recommend looking elsewhere. Tripplite/Cyberpower cannot be much worse.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Arrived w/Battery Backup outlets dead
customer_reviews.text: My second APC UPS arrived yesterday and upon unboxing and plugging it in, the battery backup outlet group was completely dead. I switched over to the surge outlets and they worked just fine. After searching the internet for anyone with the same problem, no luck. I figured I'd box it up and send back to Amazon. Before painstakingly boxing it back up, I removed the battery, unit unplugged and took the back outlet panel off carefully. There are wires attached so you can't just pry it off. I noticed that a black wire connector was disconnected. I reconnected, reassembled and viola, the unit is now working. I guess it was my LUCKY day. YMMV. -Matt
customer_reviews.author: M Miraglia

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to connect battery plus a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Battery leads are so short that connecting the battery is a virtual impossibility. Plus, the way the outlets are configured there was no way to plug in a power pack/transformer for my router. Had to plug an extension cord into the UPS then plug the router into it. A design flaw, and I would not buy again and certainly would not recommend. Should have looked more closely at the photos before buying.
customer_reviews.author: bobcat931

customer_reviews.title: Purchase Validated
customer_reviews.text: Upon considering this item, I spent over a month sitting on the fence before finally committing to it deeming it a smart investment since I now run a power hungry desktop. That said, I have not experienced any sorts of blackouts in quite a long time, but within two days of having this bad boy setup, it majestically saved me through two (yes 2) completely unrelated blackouts in a 12 hour span. Suffice it to say, while I cannot speak to the longevity of the device, so far it has worked absolutely perfectly and as intended. Would recommend for protection against storms of biblical proportions.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R

customer_reviews.title: Defective Unit - DOA .. Replacement ALSO DOA! SEE VIDEO & STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: Received the replacement unit today. Replacement unit is ALSO DOA / DEFECTIVE. Amazon needs to GET THIS PRODUCT OFF THEIR MARKETPLACE! What's going on, Amazon?? SEE VIDEO! Original Review: Always thought APC was a solid brand when it came to UPS. Brand new unit purchased, startrd chirping/beeping immediately after it was plugged in. Seemed to miss that other reviews mention this. Guess I didn't understand. Absolutely unbearable and unacceptable. APC has become trash. Have a Tripp-Lite that never did this and lasted 5 years. Going back to Tripp-Lite. Avoid this unit. Defective garbage with a clear malfunction that has been mentioned in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS CRAP. Google APC F02 error for yourself. I spoke to tech support and they confirmed it is caused buy "Battery Short" because of bad diodes. which unless your a very skilled electrician cannot be fixed. They will just WASTE a lot of your time trying to disconnect the battery doing hard resets. Makes no difference its made like Crap. I am only running 433 watts which is what they try to blame on you if you try to plug more than 1 computer into the device. Double whammy is I let it sit in the box for a month before opening and I was only able to run for 10 days before errors now I cant return!
customer_reviews.author: Budd J. Rutter

customer_reviews.title: Serious software flaw
customer_reviews.text: This UPS comes with software connected to your PC via USB. After I installed it I noticed that my computer monitor would no longer sleep. If I unplugged the USB it would sleep. I contacted their Tech Support and they admitted that as long as you are attached by USB you will not sleep. Suggested solution from APC? Unplug USB when not using computer. That of course means that in case of power outage you will no longer have a controlled shutdown. Very unsatisfactory answer and very substandard software.
customer_reviews.author: Pax Vobiscum

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $175 don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: We just received it. Pulled in 2 Samsung TVs and hour later(during middle of Toronto vs GSW) it cuts off. Beeps and everything connected (TVs) turned off. Didn’t expect to pay $175 for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Akaynia Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Fails more often than my power line
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this as backup in case the power goes out but the UPS actually failed itself before I ever had my power go out. It now shows a F04 / F02 error which can't be fixed - the unit needs to be replaced. The UPS was just over a year old. Edit: I just found out that the warranty seems to be 3 years and I'm getting a replacement sent now - so I increased the rating to 3 stars for issuing the replacement and the better than expected warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Followed directions to a T and it is emitting a chemical that is burning my eyes and throat (probably hydrogen sulfide?). Amazon refunded my money but the inconvenience is not alleviated. I bought it as a backup for my computer because I take proctored exams with it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: F09 Internal Fault in just over 30 days.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a generation 1 Back UPS Pro 1500 that I purchased in 2007 that's still going strong, albeit with a new battery. But this unit failed at the worst possible time just over a month from purchase & installation. This one runs my firewall router & POE switch, which all of my surveillance cams & primary path of my security system depend on. UPS shorted out literally 10 hours after I left for a 3 week vacation. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A Must For High End Electronics
customer_reviews.text: A few years back I bought a 75 inch flat screen to go with this UPS Battery Backup & Surge Protector. Since I used to live in Guam where residence are subject to brown and black outs, this item was a must. A friend once told me that when he got into high-end electronics, items such as this make up 30%-40% of the actual purchase. What good is it to spend $$$$$ and have that item destroyed by a lightning strike, when you could have spent $$ on an UPS Battery Backup & Surge Protector and saved yourself the heartache of mother nature slapping you in the face.
customer_reviews.author: JDiddy

customer_reviews.title: Inset On/Off button
customer_reviews.text: I had my ups all set up and running and it was fine. When I went to shut it off I couldn’t get the on/off button to work. Right before I sent it back I pushed with force and did get it to work. It’s already inset farther than the other two buttons and perhaps that’s why you have to push so hard. The button seems to be working fine now. I do love the app and am currently keeping an eye on how energy efficient my pc is. Yesterday it told me I could drive a car three miles in what it used. I was taken a little aback by that.
customer_reviews.author: Cb

customer_reviews.title: Works Great (so far)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second APC UPS so I knew what to do with this unit when it arrived. Very easy to install - just remove battery, flip it over, and push it back in. After I hooked everything up, I pulled the plug on the APC just to make sure it worked the way it is supposed to. The equipment hooked to it never skipped a beat. The only caveat is that I've only had this unit for a week or so. Reliability and long life are important and I won't know those answers for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Bernbaum

customer_reviews.title: Reliable instant electrical changeover
customer_reviews.text: Use this battery backup to protect my television, DVD, Receiver and Dish DVR. So far have not experienced any blackouts so cannot say how the unit will perform. I do have two other units protecting computers and peripherals that have performed flawlessly in the past when the electricity has gone out. The units give a warning giving more then enough time to shut everything down without losing valuable data. Duration of battery life depends on how many peripherals are in use when electricity goes out but for me, if I am available, the backup has provided power for a sufficient amount of time to shut everything down.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Third-party monitoring software not so much!
customer_reviews.text: Saves me from potential digital disasters. This product operates flawlessly. The only negative remark I have is that the software for monitoring the unit does not function properly. This is NOT the fault of APC, and is third-party software but, I feel it should be known if you are looking to purchase and need reliable monitoring software.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trust the Manufacturer, not the Seller
customer_reviews.text: UPS worked great; but none of the lights or display elements would light-up. Defective out of the box. Seller made no attempt whatsoever to troubleshoot or assist other than referring me to Schneider Electric / APC to process an RMA. Schneider rep played the 20 question game; but I was patient and finally got my replacement unit from Schneider. However, I was very disappointed in how PCNation did absolutely nothing to try and assist with the defective unit they sent me. I know and trust the APC brand; but I would not buy again from PCNation.
customer_reviews.author: FirewalkerC

customer_reviews.title: Need to hook battery right away
customer_reviews.text: When you first receive the unit, you must hook the battery up. Unfortunately, there is a design flaw here. The "hot" wire (red wire) was too short and I had to use a needle nose plier to connect. I never got to use this protector as I had to send it back. Fortunately, customer service was amazing and I received a new one within two days. This time the hot wire was longer and I was able to install the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Sing T. Loc

customer_reviews.title: Works great, replacement batteries are a best buy
customer_reviews.text: Great UPS just like the others. However, APC sells replacement batteries that come pre-connected together (with basically a large piece of plastic/tape) to fit right into the case for a reasonable price. I had been buying other brands which were slightly cheaper by 10s of dollars but their batteries are more expensive or you have to tape them together yourself. Note: You should replace your batteries every 3 years. If it has been 3 years unplug it and test it and you will see why I say that.
customer_reviews.author: Techmeister

customer_reviews.title: New Meaning To Parential Control
customer_reviews.text: On/Off button requires very small fingers to operate giving new meaning to children controlling when they will let you use the computer. No customer service only a forum. F04 error code indicates a clamp short - meaning either a manufacturing or design defect which is non repairable. The only option you have is the company will give you a discount on a new unit. Trying to silence the alarm with that small button is unsatisfactory. APC 1500 Unit is less than a year old. It will not even allow you to use your computer with wall outlet power.
customer_reviews.author: john wolf

customer_reviews.title: Possible Used unit
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received the battery door was broken and the negative wire was already connected, this item was either used or they broke the battery door and forget to disconnect the wire before shipping...item took 3 weeks for me to recieved therefore I cant bother to return unless units start giving problem or die I'll update
customer_reviews.author: Andre K.

customer_reviews.title: A must have Battery Back Up for sensitive equiptment
customer_reviews.text: When we first came to Florida we were not aware of the damage a weak power grid can do to electronics like TV, Computers, Monitors, Routers, networks, Stereos. Black outs are frequent, but even more damaging is" Over Voltage, and Under Voltages" and out right voltage Spikes. This unit goes on battery until power fluctuations are stabilized.
customer_reviews.author: DaPoppa1

customer_reviews.title: Never worked out of the box and I cant return it.
customer_reviews.text: Charged over night, plugged in appliance, the battery was dead in 15 minutes. Battery can not hold charge or never charged in the first place. Now as I try to return it, I keep getting sent to phone or chat and neither work and I can NOT return it either. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Trusted APC quality
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. I don't have issues with chirping that others have complained about. My only real complaint is the typical layout of the battery backed up outlets being so close that you can really only 3 if your plugs are the oversized adapters. Not everyone uses these for servers or computers only as I have my NAS and some other home equipment on it so there should be some considerations for these uses when designing.
customer_reviews.author: RotorBalls

customer_reviews.title: Not fully functional out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike all the other APC battery backups I've purchased over the past 15 years, this one is shipped with its battery disconnected and they expect you to open it up and connect it before first use. All others purchased were ready to go out of the box. Without this information on Amazon you will be left wondering why you're unit is not charging as I was. Misleading advertising at best. A notice of instructions and the fact that the unit is not ready for prime time should have been in bold print, front and center. Shame on APC and Amazon if they knew better. I'll think twice before purchasing another APC.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I have had so many problems with my computer due to power outages and brown outs. This solved my issues (after fixing them of course). Prior to this, there was a power surge and my rgb went heywire and the software stopped working. I wiped the hard drive and reinstalled everything after getting this. Now the power outages and brown outs have not effected my PC. Not to mention that my PC doesn't shut down on me when the power goes out. It's a life saver
customer_reviews.author: Justin Campos

customer_reviews.title: The battery will last for about 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a while, I have 3 in the home. I have grown used to plugging everything into a battery back up just because I have seen a difference in the lack of failures in my electronic products. I have had problems in power strips multiple times, but this device is something that has always been dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work (update)
customer_reviews.text: Battery won't charge even after several days. Alarm is defining. Control buttons work sporadically. Company isn't interested in fixing it. After working with Amazon who connected me to the manufacturer, a replacement is on the way.
customer_reviews.author: S. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Just in Time
customer_reviews.text: I had two UPS systems years ago but they got fried by bad house electricity. I bought this after I lost 3 not inexpensive items due to a power company voltage spike. We have had 10 spikes since then, the unit keeps count, and no problem at all. The UPS did what it was designed to do and saved me an expensive incident. It has six surge outlets and six surge outlets with battery backup. APC is also a quality company.
customer_reviews.author: CGA

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this power supply for emergency back up for a saltwater reef tank. I use it to power 2 power heads for circulation. With both power heads plugged in, I can get approximately 8 hrs of power. The only issue I have with the unit is when the room is quiet, there is a very annoying pulsing whining noise every few seconds. This seems to be a known issue with older units.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger backup solution for a high-end GPU tower computer. This device has the oomph to handle the higher power load. Great information display. Buttons aren't obvious, so need the manual near the box, but - HOPEFULLY won't have to fiddle with it much (if at all). Love the power output, and it is at a good price. I have seen similar sized non-APC ("cyberpower") devices FAIL to switch in fast enough during brownouts/power surges while their APC counterparts handled the situation flawlessly. I would buy this again in a heartbeat (I actually have two, will buy more)!
customer_reviews.author: sipy

customer_reviews.title: No battery on the battery backup
customer_reviews.text: Kinda hard to use a battery backup without a battery. Whoever did the qc check needs to be fired.
customer_reviews.author: Walter LeFort

customer_reviews.title: APC makes the best backup UPS
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to backup the power for a continuously running machine. Never seems to get more than 97% charge though. Don't know if this is merely a quirk of the monitoring software or some problem with the battery. Bought it as a replacement for CyberPower AVR1200 which would switch to battery power for AVR protection but would often stay on battery even when voltage levels returned to normal. This caused the battery to run down bringing down the protected system with it. So far, the APC unit hasn't done this. I have other APC Backups. Changing the battery is easy.
customer_reviews.author: DAV

customer_reviews.title: great battery backup
customer_reviews.text: I use several of these on various computers and they will power a 27” iMac at least an hour of net surfing with a bunch of other background tasks going on. In reality it may go longer, but I got bored trying to run the battery down to zero. You can turn the beep warning off if you want and it has a nice wattage display too. I’m getting about 3+ years out of the batteries before having to replace and I would recommend replacing them on a schedule. it’s likely you’ll find out the battery is faulted when there’s a power event if you don’t.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: Good battery capacity
customer_reviews.text: Good battery capacity, compatible with Linux (using apcupsd). Pretty small and easy to put in a corner. 10 outlets is good, too bad only 5 of them are battery backed. It could run a *lot* of small servers (cable modems, raspberry pies, wifi access points, etc) on the battery since they use barely any power but the 5 outlets limit the usage somewhat. The display on the front is nice and clear and the statistics you can get over USB are more than sufficient to satisfy any geek. The only thing I would like to see added is metering on the outlets to determine how much power each individual outlet uses.
customer_reviews.author: Gerco

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE JULY 2019: Best ups for the price
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE JULY 2019: I originally bought 3 of these at the same time. So far 2 of them are working fine. But the last one is somehow broken. It will not go on to ac power anymore and constantly cycles back and forth between ac and battery. I took it apart to see if it was a loose conections or bad part. But I could not find anything. Ive been using apc ups's for the last 8 years and ive never had a problem with over 10 of them. yes they changed there size and made it smaller but its nice to have a compact ups that still pulls the juice.
customer_reviews.author: Иiск Р

customer_reviews.title: Great UPS!!!
customer_reviews.text: APC is the leader when it comes to UPS's. After going through a few power outages with my Wifes and I's computers we decided to invest in this for peace of mind. Sure enough its worked every time and the software was easy to install and setup with the UPS. A++ product that should be a must with your Desktop, TV or other import electronics you want to keep safe.
customer_reviews.author: 40rty

customer_reviews.title: Repeatedly cut power to devices on Battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this APC UPS to replace my previous CyberPower UPS that had failed after 7 years of service without issue. In the few weeks I have had this new unit, it has lost power to the computer and monitor I had connected to the battery side. I don't know if it is merely faulty or just incapable of switching to battery during short power spikes, but I am going back to a CyberPower unit of equal specs even if it does cost more. I am not sure if I can confidently buy another consumer-grade UPS from APC again anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Product
customer_reviews.text: Use this UPS for satellite receiver & tv. Purchased in Nov. and at first worked well. Suddenly a power blip would cause tv to turn off but receiver okay. Screen read out as battery fully charged with over 20 minutes of run time based on load. Checked connections & even set Sensitivity Level to maximum. Tested unit & all checked out okay. Then the same thing happened a couple of more times. We are now getting annoyed. Yesterday a few second power blip shut off both tv & receiver. Today the UPS was returned. We wanted a reliable, uninterruptible backup power supply. This unit did not live up to that expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Dotty's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and finish, confidence inspiring quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work as a backup power supply in a semi-truck mostly because the engine cuts power to equipment in my cab when it turns over. It has performed perfectly on the month or so I’ve had it installed. It will not keep a 700 watt microwave running but I wasn’t expecting it to do that. It feels very well built and came with great instructions and even a full factory test report for the specific unit. Overall it’s extremely easy to use and most of all extremely reliable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maccarron

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to replace
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these. First one is still kicking. Second one, started acting up in 6 months. Just shutting down on its own and taking everything with it. Multiple times I've been awakened to the fire alarm noise this thing makes when it shuts down on its own. Today, it finally bit the dust, 14 months in.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Works until it doesn't.  Then you are on your own, literally.
customer_reviews.text: Assurion is a worthless added expense. Battery life is terrible and will seldom exceed maunfacturer's warranty. APC Schneider warranty registration means nothing, as they will feign ingornace of your warranty - that you may entrust at time of purchase and installation. It is incumbent for you to retain all details, invoices, serial numbers, installation dates, to prosecute any claim service. Be prepared for a lengthy phone call with all parties, Amazon, Assurion, and APC Schneider. Your time means little. It took me 2 hours on the phone to resolvce as imple battery issue. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Harold A. Tate, MD

customer_reviews.title: Not returnable.
customer_reviews.text: Unit had a strong electrical burn smell right out of the box. After plugging it in the smell got worse. I started to cough and had watering eyes. I tried to return it and found out it is not returnable. So I can not use it or send it back. If you buy this you are stuck with it whether it works or not.
customer_reviews.author: rmundinger

customer_reviews.title: Good UPS for frequent outages
customer_reviews.text: I've had the APC BX1500M UPS for a few months now, and so far, so good. It has gracefully handled multiple power outages and some pretty nasty brown-outs. It is powering my desktop PC, monitor, and cable modem, and will easily last a half hour, likely 45 minutes or more before the battery is exhausted. Transitions are smooth; the computer does not seem to notice when a power bump occurs. The UPS display has handy information (like power consumption and minutes remaining) and, importantly, a silence button to stop any beeping.
customer_reviews.author: Science Tech

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome product
customer_reviews.text: as per my personal experience, this product is great! my son has premium gaming desktop and but with unknown reasons (especially while raining) system was shutting off and need to discharge CMOS battery @ motherboard. it could be dirty ATX power supply or home power network. but after installation of this product we never get power issue at mother board and now he is playing games with peaceful mind. I would recommend this product for users especially for hardcore gamers :)
customer_reviews.author: Harikrishna

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased dozens of APC backups
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased dozens of APC backups. Not because they fail, but because I need more electronics on battery backups. I own everything from small APC backups through enterprise rack mounted systems. They always work. Battery replacement can be expensive when you need it, but there are 3rd party companies available that I have used for sometimes half the price and the same longevity. Please APC, price your batteries better! Otherwise, I love your backups!
customer_reviews.author: blossombubble

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for use with PS4 / PS4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a UPS for my PS4 pro, so far so good. The display is nice since you can easily tell what your load is and how much time you can run off of the battery in the vent of a loss of commercial power.
customer_reviews.author: M. Good

customer_reviews.title: Good back-up for any sensitive electronic device/s
customer_reviews.text: I set this up for our entertainment system to avoid losing data when we have a short term power outage. The unit works well keeping a constant voltage to all components when sudden minor power outages occur. The only thing that would make this better, placing the outlets for the typical devices of today. Many power plugs have the transformer as part of the plug, once you install one it covers two outlets. I used a power strip to be able to utilize all the power outlets that were available on the unit.
customer_reviews.author: GMYDOC

customer_reviews.title: This powers my 350W amplifier, a PC with a ...
customer_reviews.text: This powers my 350W amplifier, a PC with a 600W power supply and two video cards, and a laptop for about 15 minutes. (300W constant draw) Lessen the load, and it'll run forever!! It takes over 8 hours to recharge when drawn all the way down. Overall, I'm very impressed with this products capabilities!
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: Literally saved my new PC from a blackout within a day of hooking it up.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as I've just built a new PC, investing much more money than I would like a rogue burst of electricity to kill. Within one day, a power surge hit while I was doing work- the unit was heard immediately switching to the battery and my PC never flinched- this blackout was accurately timed and recorded in the software. Given that this blackout rendered my living room, rinky-dinky surge protector unusable, I believe it very well could have roasted my PC- but both it and the UPS survived unscathed. Imagine the luck, here
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Returns not allowed to your advantage
customer_reviews.text: Did not work and you will not help me solve knowledge to return. Tried before May 31,2020. It is only June 1,2020. There are no representatives to Suresh with to solve. Fine on purpose I believe so no one can return items to your advantage.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Rillie

customer_reviews.title: Let me keep working!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a real UPS like this and it does the job perfectly....Have already lost power to the house twice during storms for about 10 to 20 minutes each time and both times my computer, both monitors and the modem/router continued to work just fine. The unit looks modern and attractive, but it is HEAVY. If course that means it won't fall over, and cat can't abuse it, but that was a surprise to me. I didn't realize how heavy this type of units are. I would definitely purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Myschief

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love not loosing power during those quick power outages, much easier on the equipment. I like how it tells you how many outages there were, estimated remaining battery, power using and other information. Highly recommend this, don't know why we waited so long to get one of these...very hard on electronic equipment when it goes off and on five times in a row.
customer_reviews.author: D. Paterno

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than my last one
customer_reviews.text: Thus far it's performing perfectly. This one replaced a previous almost identical model that worked, albeit with less technical goodies, for a bit more than 5 years. Hence my purchase of this model from the same company. I've only had this unit for several months and I am happy with it. The minor problem for me was getting the lid back on after placing the batteries into working position. I have noticed a slight odor which I presume is from the batteries charging as nothing abnormal is indicated. I have my computer tower containing multiple SSD, optical drives, 24" monitor in the back up position and several other items in the others. Good bang for my bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 20-year old APC backup that finally died (that's not to say the batteries weren't replaced a few times). I'm not sure what's up with some of the low rated reviews and I'm certainly not questioning them but my experience, several months in, has been fine. It just works when we get the occasional one-minute power outage.
customer_reviews.author: IDGuy

customer_reviews.title: Has saved my bacon several times
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so i could keep working when the power went out. I have two laptops and three monitors connected to the battery portion. I am able to work for over an hour when the power goes out before the battery finally quits. This gives me time to get my generator going so that I can keep working. I have 4 of these in the house powering my laptops, networking gear, entertainment, and a NAS device. They have never failed me and i would recommend them to anyone needing a reliable UPS
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Desktop and monitor backup power
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my desktop computer that I need to connect back to. Little power flickers and power outages used to shut it off. This has been helpful to keep it going without worry. Was hovering around 80 min of life left after an hour with a desktop and laptop powered off of it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Svensson

customer_reviews.title: It Does Its Job
customer_reviews.text: I am running a beefy PC so I needed a beefy backup. I've had this for a bit over a month, and I finally got to experience its benefit--we had a very brief outage. My PC stayed on w/o a glitch. But, it made me realize I needed to get one for my router! :D
customer_reviews.author: Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first unit to Amazon since it was emitting a toxic odor, which I found out happens rarely on some units. The new one that arrived works flawlessly, though, and Amazon was able to swap them without charge. The new UPS works great, even under heavy load!!!
customer_reviews.author: RedFalcon696

customer_reviews.title: USELESS BRICK! DO NOT BUY! APC IS THE WORST
customer_reviews.text: Only my Desktop Computer was plugged in. Power went out. Heard beeping in computer room. Battery backup did NOTHING! Computer was OFF! All opened work lost. This is a complete waste of money piece of trash garbage. I'm so angry right now at this fraud company and their crap product. It literally does nothing. WASTE OF MONEY!!! This COST me money in lost work. Not enough bad things to say about APC. APC are scumbags
customer_reviews.author: TD (T Dickens)

customer_reviews.title: 2 years no problem - 4 major outtages
customer_reviews.text: Kept us up and running without a hitch through 4 major power outtages during business hours. This powers our NAS farm, modem and VOIP interface. Kept everything up for over an hour one time. Switch over to battery power was perfect - no interruptions or equipment resets. Likewise when power restored, switch back transparent. Buy APC, they work. A few bucks more but worth the peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Cheapdude

customer_reviews.title: Very nice UPS unit the size of a small-format desktop PC.
customer_reviews.text: *Easy installation of unit and software with plenty of battery/surge and surge protection outlets. Software allows inspection of incidents, electrical costs, etc. Follow-on comment: Received the UPS two months ago and have had two interventions so far. Perhaps the best praise I can give is that I didn't know that power had failed until I checked the supplied APC PowerChute app days later. I am a satisfied user.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Caputo

customer_reviews.title: Check to validate what APC you have for instuctions
customer_reviews.text: The device arrived on time and was heavier than I thought. The instructions in the beginning were a little confusing as it had all APC devices to set up. Once I realized I had to find my model then it was easy with no issues. The APC came with a QA report which was dated back in August 2019 and was very faded, made me think this was a refurbished machine. The machine is running perfectly as the house I am in has power outages a few time a week ranging from seconds to hours. This will prevent my router to be shorted out again like the last one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great I only wish I had bought it WITH my ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems we have people in this house that feel the need to fight the frigid 76 degree house temp with multiple electrical heaters and hair dryers. Since they can't be convinced to knock it off they are frequently blowing the circuit breakers creating spikes in the line that hit my computer not to mention power drop with no orderly shut down of the OS. So... this UPS was purchased to buffer my computer from all this and shut it down in an orderly manner when the power drops. It shuts the computer down via USB to the software bought separately in a controlled manner. It works great I only wish I had bought it WITH my computer. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Fails every 24 to 48 hours
customer_reviews.text: Chirps like crickets... every 24 to 48 hours you'll need to: 1.) Turn off everything connected to it 2.) Power it down 3.) Unplug it from the wall 4.) Remove the battery 5.) Hold the on/off button in for 20-30 seconds 6.) Plug the battery back in 7.) Reconnect everything 8.) Power back on 9.) wait for 24 to 48 hours 10.) Do this all over again Its junk... keep browsing...
customer_reviews.author: Dave Watson

customer_reviews.title: Already saved me once
customer_reviews.text: Severe power fluctuations in my neighborhood - I kept working like nothing happened - didn't realize I'd had power fluctuations for an hour or so until later. I'm running a pretty intense 3D modeling PC with two monitors and it cruised through my brief brownout no problem. Apparently out in the living room the lights were flickering and the TV shut off a couple times. Only once was the power off long enough for it to squeak at me - which alerted me to what was going on. Zero interruption despite local power grid disturbance. This ought to give me 20-30 minutes if I completely lost power, which is loads of time. Compact, quiet, and actually kinda pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: UPS does not stop my computer from shutting down when power flickers or goes out. I have to manually restart the computer in order to get the battery to kick in. This causes me to lose work and progress when it restarts suddenly. Awaiting tech support now. Will edit the review when I receive contact and resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with generator.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in hopes with the AVR technology it would not switch to battery backup when using our generator. Unfortunately it does not. We have tried a multitude of settings and it will still not run on the generator any better than the standard APC that we were using. It does give more time to shutdown the computer than the smaller one but that's about it. We are keeping only because we needed one for the livingroom due to occasional power blips and it keeps the dish receiver from resetting. From what I have read these APC will even have problems with the best inverter generator.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: I trust APC, I have one that has been running for 5 years on original battery.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth reliable performance. I gave it my acid test, I unplugged it while running a 600 watt sound system, 55-inch TV (10 years old, a newer one probably draws less current), DVR box, Roku streaming device. It ran for 12 minutes, I plugged it back in before it ran out. I like that it was totally quiet, and has a mute button. My old one lasted longer but had no mute so it kept sounding an annoying alarm every 15 seconds and kept making noises like some really large mill motors were being started over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Don Harlson

customer_reviews.title: GAMING PC WITH I9-9900K 2080 TI UPS LOAD AT 72 MINUTES AT IDLE NO OVERCLOCK.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, bought this because of California's wildfire problem, and since pg&e was sued for the camp fire they keep shutting off our power every time there is some heavy dry winds. This is recent stuff there doing and i just built myself a $3000 gaming computer and i am no taking any risks. We have had brownouts in the pass, microwaves not heating all the way fridge on low power mode and flickering lights usually around winter time. Will probably come back and update this review so far I've had this for one day. and everything seems to work fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - APC TECH SUPPORT DISCLAIMS CERTAIN USES
customer_reviews.text: After 2.5 years, my UPS started to malfunction. When I wrote in to tech support, they informed me that the UPS is not intended for routers, or NAS hard drives and that they would void the warranty for continued use. To directly quote Tech Support: "Back-UPS of any model are not compatible to protect any kind and any types of Servers, Networks, Switches, Motorized Device and Printers. Back-Ups are made for home use to protect Home PC, Home Router and Home Modem"
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far the APC UPS 1350VA has function perfectly. I have not had yet had need to use it in a real world situation, however I intentionally tripped a circuit breaker to see what would happen and the APC picked up the load for all the plugged in devices without a problem. I let it run down until the indicator said the battery was drain, but even at that point all of the devices reminded on; which more than meets my needs for this UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shopping from Amazon - trusting they will help with problems
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these power supplies. One was in perfect condition and works well. The other one rattled when taken out of the box. Due to family issues and illnesses, we were not able to have time to set them up prior to "Amazons 30 day return policy" which I did not know about until later. They are not able to help at all. These cost way too much to have to deal with the manufacturer and spend more time trying to resolve the problem with the defective one that was sent to us by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: traveler1977

customer_reviews.title: So far a great product.
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's serving me great. I leave the unit(s) on silent. I've bought this item four times already. A must have for desktop computers, no justifying it otherwise. Data and component corruption can happen if not protected from surges, and/or shut down properly. People spend a good deal of money on components, like a GPU, but barely go in for a good UPS.
customer_reviews.author: supercyberfunk

customer_reviews.title: Did Its Job
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this UPS to diagnose a power delivery issue in my PC. Setup was easy and instructions were detailed. However seeing as how the UPS didn't fix my problem I returned it. I came to the conclusion that it was motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and efficient. Don't even notice it is there until you need it and then it kicks in immediately. I have been usin APC products for years and they have all been great with never any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V. Oconnell

customer_reviews.title: Back-Ups 1000
customer_reviews.text: I am happy so far with this unit. We had an extended outage recently and when the power goes out the unit displays run time at the current power draw. When it is connected to power it reads the line voltage. I have had a number of APC units with good results. The unit that this replaced was many years old and had gotten to the point that it was eating batteries, the batteries were getting quite warm so I assume it was overcharging them. The mute button is handy when the power is off for an extended time so the alarm can be silenced.
customer_reviews.author: amazon1

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for your gaming pc
customer_reviews.text: Have used various UPS products in my line of work over the years and APC is one of the top brands for a good reason. I got the 1500AVR version which can handle just about any desktop computer out there. The included auto-shutdown and monitoring software works great (Win 10). I've seen various reports of heat issues - haven't experienced this yet but will keep an eye on it. Apparently placing this in a rack or area with good cooling and/or a fan is a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, nice display, stable power
customer_reviews.text: I got this battery, because power at my house flickers off fairly often. This can't be good for expensive computer components. I hooked up my computer, monitors, and router, and load tested using PC benchmark software. The display showed the power, which was within expected ranges and well under the maximum load for the unit. Works for my i7 4790k, SLI (2x) 970 GTX G1, and EVGA SuperNOVA 750 G3. Computer has been more stable since installation. It has several outlets that are only surge protected (not battery protected), which I used to hook up a fan and lamp.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: When setting up battery for first time, it is difficult to remove and install internal battery.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like having to remove and install the battery. Figured out how to get it out of the case and unwrap the adhesive, but the two battery pieces separated during the unwrapping process. I have them back in the case and the battery is working. I can not get the case to close now so it is laying on its side but operating. I understand shipping required that the battery not be connected. I would recommend going to a local store and buying a power back up with the battery already connected. I will do that next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: I live in an older apartment with bad wiring, I'm sure this thing has saved my computer many times. I will hear it click on randomly to regulate power to my computer, and it has let me shut down normally during a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Cole

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've had my TV, Apple TV and Tivo hooked up to this box and it has worked as advertised during a power failure. Additionally I had a thunderstorm roll through today and during a power surge the indicator says it surged to 243 volts right after a nearby lighting strike. The TV and equipment was turned off, but fired back up with no problems after the storm had rolled through. I'm convinced it probably saved me $500 or more damage. While no surge / battery back up is completely fool proof, I was impressed with the protection it offered today. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: We trust APC - been using them for almost 20 years
customer_reviews.text: We live in an area where we have frequent power outages. Probably have at least 7 APC units of varying sizes all around the house. When power goes out I can plug them into the generator and they keep a constant voltage. No need to buy a warranty from 3rd party; just register it on apc site. In the past I've had to return one and they delivered new one before I had to send old one back.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy

customer_reviews.title: Long Longevity
customer_reviews.text: I got this product a while ago, however, I was unable to use it immediately because of my PCS. Fast forward several months at my new location and I'm able to use it. Move along three weeks and now my pretty much brand new battery backup and surge protector is alarming about how it can't do it's job. I had a much lower rater battery backup for years and it never failed to do it's job during that long stretch. I was expecting much better quality from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Works great, stays mostly quiet
customer_reviews.text: Works great, stays mostly quiet, even when on battery backup (once the alarm is turned off). Keeps my server running long enough to get through any small power issues, and shut down properly and still have left over power for extended power losses. If you need lots more run time, look at the other APC 1500 options which can also take a second battery pack tower to add significant run time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Saved my projects
customer_reviews.text: This little thing backed up my power as soon as my area had a power outage. Seamless. Also powered my hard drives, Mac Pro and other essentials to give me enough time to save everything and shut down safely. It had 40 mins of battery life, so I had plenty of time to do what I needed to do. I could have been getting coffee at the other end of the office, and still had enough time to stroll back and do everything I needed to do. Calmly. Awesome for the price, too. Get it, if you depend on big projects on computers. It's affordable and will save hours of work....and possible hardware damage.
customer_reviews.author: ChasingTheLight

customer_reviews.title: Easy stuff
customer_reviews.text: This was all of installing the battery. and then plugging in my items. I am using this as a backup power supply for my main gaming computer with dual monitors. I have yet to see this fail me from what it should be doing. Once the power went out in the middle of the night and the sound (From the UPS) was able to wake me up. This has also prevented the computer from going off in the middle of a game when the power is not constant. Overall really happy I got this and well worth the money for it. As it helps keep my more expensive computer safe.
customer_reviews.author: MadcatMDM

customer_reviews.title: Hardware OK, Software Poor
customer_reviews.text: I was quite pleased with the Back-UPS 1500 that I bought 5 years ago. Perhaps I will eventually get to that point with this new purchase, but so far this has provided a series of frustrations and disappointments. 1. At this price range, the protected outlets should be space far enough apart to plug in transformers side-by-side.But that is not possible. 2. More importantly, the Powerchute v3 software has the ridiculous feature of triggering the Windows UAC message each time you open the app. 3. The doc provided by Amazon incorrectly said the box included a software CD. I wasted a lot of time looking for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey E. Gutsell

customer_reviews.title: Saved my equipment many times - others failed that couldn't be protected
customer_reviews.text: Saved my equipment many times. Other equipment failed that couldn't be protected due to location or nothing really to protect it (i.e. low level circuit boards on AC unit). Direct lightning strike that neighbors had damage, hit 3 transformers here, mine was all fine, except for circuit card that controls the garage door opener (not on UPS).
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. May
